items: Learn about the GNU Project and its goals
Become familiar with the Linux kernel

sections.heading: The Problem in the 1980s
paragraphs: In the 1980s, Unix was a powerful operating system, but it was expensive and proprietary.
Only universities, governments, and large companies could afford to use it.

sections.heading: GNU Project
paragraphs: Richard Stallman started the GNU Project in 1983 to create a free, Unix-like operating system.
The project created free tools like compilers, editors, and libraries, but it still needed a kernel.

sections.heading: Linux Kernel
paragraphs: In 1991, Linus Torvalds, a Finnish student, released the Linux kernel.
When combined with GNU tools, it became a fully working operating system: GNU/Linux.
Today, Linux powers servers, phones (Android), and even supercomputers.

sections.heading: Key Terms
rows: A powerful, proprietary OS from the 1970s
The core of an operating system that manages hardware
Core program of Linux created by Linus Torvalds
Software anyone can view, modify, and share

sections.text: The combination of GNU tools and the Linux kernel is what makes most Linux distributions today!

bullets: Linux was created because Unix was expensive and closed-source.
The GNU Project aimed to create a free Unix-like system.
Linus Torvalds built the missing piece: the Linux kernel.
Together they formed GNU/Linux, powering millions of devices today.

choices: To create a free Unix-like system
